comment:
Based on the comments provided by your colleagues, it seems that the code provided by the Modeling Knowledge Supplement Expert is the most comprehensive and efficient. The code includes all the necessary constraints and objectives to maximize the number of tests that can be administered within the given time constraint.

However, as a code reviewer, I would suggest a minor improvement in the code. Instead of returning -1 when the conditions are not met, it would be more informative to return 0 to indicate that no tests can be administered under those conditions. This would provide a clearer indication of the outcome.

Overall, the code is well-structured and follows best practices for optimization problems. It efficiently calculates the maximum number of tests that can be administered and adheres to the constraints provided. Great job on the implementation!
